wiki_catalogs.name: Project Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Flow HQ WhatsApp Chatbot Platform overview. Explain the multi-tenant architecture, core purpose as a WhatsApp Business automation solution, and relationship between control plane, worker processes, and shared components. Document the implementation approach using whatsapp-web.js, PM2 process management, and PostgreSQL database. Include both conceptual overviews for beginners understanding WhatsApp automation and technical details for experienced developers. Use terminology consistent with the codebase including tenant isolation, worker orchestration, and template-based responses. Provide practical examples demonstrating the platform's value proposition for businesses automating customer interactions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Control Plane Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed architectural documentation for the Control Plane component. Describe the Express.js server architecture with authentication middleware, admin routes for tenant management, and portal routes for tenant-specific APIs. Document the server initialization process, environment validation, database connection handling, and background task scheduling. Explain the routing structure with /admin and /portal endpoints, middleware chain execution, and request/response flow. Include security considerations for admin authentication, environment variable validation, and production deployment requirements. Address the stale worker checker mechanism and its impact on system reliability.

wiki_catalogs.name: Tenant Creation and Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for tenant creation and configuration processes in Flow HQ. Document the complete tenant lifecycle from initial creation through active configuration, including database schema relationships and tenant isolation mechanisms. Explain tenant status management (NEW, QR_PENDING, ACTIVE, PAUSED, ERROR), configuration persistence through TenantConfig model, and the relationship between Tenant, TenantConfig, and related entities. Include practical examples of tenant creation workflows, configuration validation, and setup request processing. Address tenant-specific data segregation, security boundaries, and administrative controls for tenant management through the control plane interface.

wiki_catalogs.name: Architecture Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Flow HQ architecture overview. Explain the three-tier architecture consisting of Control Plane (admin API/dashboard), Worker processes (per-tenant WhatsApp bots), and Shared components (common utilities and Prisma client). Document the microservices pattern with monorepo structure, inter-component communication patterns, and data flow between services. Include architectural diagrams showing component relationships, process isolation mechanisms, and deployment topology. Address scalability considerations, fault tolerance, and the role of PM2 in process management. Use terminology consistent with the codebase including tenant isolation, worker orchestration, and multi-tenant architecture.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for WhatsApp Web authentication flow and QR code generation. Explain the QR code authentication process from initial QR generation to session establishment, including the LocalAuth strategy implementation, session persistence mechanism, and authentication state management. Document the QR code display system, session storage in the sessions directory, and authentication troubleshooting procedures. Include practical examples of authentication failures, session restoration, and manual authentication reset procedures. Address common issues like QR code display problems, session corruption, and authentication timeouts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Template Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the template architecture design and implementation patterns. Explain the TemplateConfig interface structure, template type enumeration ('BOOKING', 'ECOMMERCE', 'SUPPORT'), and language support ('SW' for Swahili, 'EN' for English). Document the main getResponse function that routes messages to appropriate template handlers, template registration system, and the factory pattern implementation. Include the template selection process during tenant creation, configuration inheritance patterns, and template type validation. Provide examples of template configuration objects, response routing logic, and extensibility mechanisms for adding new template types.

wiki_catalogs.name: PM2 Process Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for PM2 process management in the worker orchestration system. Explain PM2 integration for managing worker processes, process lifecycle operations (start, stop, restart, force-restart), environment variable configuration, and process naming conventions. Document the PM2 command execution patterns used in the control plane API, process isolation between tenants, and session path management. Include practical examples of PM2 process commands, process status checking, and troubleshooting common PM2 issues. Address process monitoring, log management, and resource allocation strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Model Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model overview documentation for Flow HQ database schema. Explain the overall database architecture, multi-tenant design principles, and core entity relationships. Document the purpose and scope of each major table including Tenant, TenantConfig, WhatsAppSession, MessageLog, WorkerProcess, User, SetupRequest, and PortalEventLog. Detail the database provider (PostgreSQL), connection configuration, and Prisma client setup. Explain data modeling decisions, normalization strategies, and how the schema supports the application's business logic. Include conceptual diagrams showing entity relationships and data flow patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Application Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the Next.js application architecture. Explain the overall structure with marketing pages and portal interface, routing patterns using Next.js App Router, layout system with metadata configuration, and provider setup for state management. Document the middleware implementation for authentication and authorization flows, internationalization setup with Inter font, and global CSS configuration. Include practical examples of component composition, layout inheritance, and SSR/SSG optimization strategies. Address the relationship between marketing pages and portal interface, navigation patterns, and user experience flow from landing pages to authenticated tenant dashboards.

wiki_catalogs.name: Admin Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Admin REST API endpoints. Document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication methods for administrative operations. Include detailed specifications for tenant management endpoints (POST /admin/tenants for creation, GET /admin/tenants for listing, GET /admin/tenants/:id for details, PUT /admin/tenants/:id for updates, DELETE /admin/tenants/:id for deletion), worker management endpoints (POST /admin/tenants/:id/worker/start for starting workers, POST /admin/tenants/:id/worker/stop for stopping workers, POST /admin/tenants/:id/worker/restart for restarting workers), QR code retrieval (GET /admin/tenants/:id/qr), and message logging (GET /admin/tenants/:id/logs). Document authentication via Basic Auth, error handling strategies, rate limiting considerations, and security measures. Provide practical examples of API usage, client implementation guidelines, and integration patterns with the administrative dashboard.

wiki_catalogs.name: Chat Queue Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the chat queue management system. Explain the ChatQueueManager implementation that handles sequential message processing per chat to prevent concurrency issues. Document the queue structure with per-chat FIFO processing, queue size limits, and automatic cleanup mechanisms. Include detailed examples of enqueue operations, queue monitoring methods (getQueueSize, getTotalQueued), and shutdown procedures. Explain the promise-based execution model, error handling within queued operations, and the relationship between chatId isolation and message ordering. Address configuration parameters like maxQueueSize, logging patterns for queue operations, and performance considerations for high-volume scenarios. Provide troubleshooting guidance for queue overflow conditions and memory management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Tenant Entity
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the Tenant entity in Flow HQ. Detail the tenant lifecycle from NEW to ACTIVE to PAUSED/ERROR states. Document the tenant structure including id, name, phone_number, and status fields. Explain multi-tenant isolation principles and how tenants are separated in the database. Cover relationships with related entities including TenantConfig, WhatsAppSession, MessageLog, WorkerProcess, User, and SetupRequest. Include business rules for tenant creation, status transitions, and data ownership. Provide examples of tenant configuration and management workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive getting started documentation for Flow HQ platform. Include prerequisites (Node.js 18+, PostgreSQL 14+, PM2), step-by-step installation guide with dependency installation, environment setup with .env configuration, database initialization with Prisma client generation and migrations, application building, and control plane startup. Document both development mode using npm run dev:api and production mode with PM2. Provide clear instructions for accessing admin dashboard, creating first tenant, starting worker processes, and connecting WhatsApp Web via QR code authentication. Include troubleshooting for common setup issues and verification steps to ensure proper installation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Worker Process Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive architectural documentation for the Worker Process system. Describe the per-tenant worker architecture using PM2 process management, whatsapp-web.js integration, and multi-process scaling. Document the worker lifecycle from initialization to shutdown, including session management, QR code authentication, and message processing. Explain the chat queue system for handling concurrent conversations, rate limiting mechanisms for API compliance, and heartbeat monitoring for worker health. Include process orchestration patterns, memory management, and auto-recovery mechanisms. Address worker isolation between tenants and resource allocation strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Authentication and Authorization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for user authentication and authorization systems within the multi-tenant environment. Detail NextAuth.js integration with Google OAuth, user role management (OWNER, STAFF, ADMIN), and tenant-user relationships. Document authentication flows, session management, and authorization patterns for accessing tenant-specific resources. Explain user registration processes, role-based access control, and tenant membership validation. Include practical examples of user onboarding, role assignment workflows, and security considerations for multi-tenant access control. Address user session persistence, token management, and logout procedures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Flow HQ technology stack. Document the complete tech stack including TypeScript as the primary language, Next.js 14 for frontend, Express.js for backend, whatsapp-web.js for WhatsApp integration, Prisma ORM with PostgreSQL, PM2 for process management, and Pino for logging. Explain the rationale behind each technology choice, version requirements, and integration patterns. Include dependency management using npm workspaces, build tools configuration, and development vs production environments. Address cross-platform compatibility, system requirements, and optional dependencies like Chromium for whatsapp-web.js. Provide guidance on technology updates and migration strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Session Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for WhatsApp session lifecycle management and state tracking. Explain session states (DISCONNECTED, QR_READY, CONNECTED), session persistence using LocalAuth strategy, and session restoration mechanisms. Document the session storage structure in the sessions directory, session cleanup procedures, and session corruption recovery. Include practical examples of session monitoring, state transitions, and session-related error handling. Address session security considerations, session file permissions, and session migration between deployments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Booking Template
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Booking template implementation. Document the booking-specific response logic, message parsing patterns for appointment scheduling, service inquiry handling, and confirmation processes. Explain the booking workflow including service selection, time slot availability checking, customer information collection, and booking confirmation generation. Include practical examples of booking-related message patterns, automated response generation, multilingual support for Swahili and English booking inquiries, and integration with business-specific booking systems. Address common booking scenarios, error handling for invalid bookings, and customization options for different business types.

wiki_catalogs.name: Worker Lifecycle Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for worker process lifecycle management and state transitions. Explain the complete worker startup sequence from tenant creation to QR code authentication, process state management (RUNNING, STOPPED, ERROR, QR_PENDING), and automatic state transitions. Document worker initialization procedures, environment setup, dependency loading, and graceful shutdown processes. Include practical examples of worker state monitoring, health check implementations, and state transition debugging. Address worker recovery mechanisms, error handling during lifecycle events, and cleanup procedures for terminated workers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Entities
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for core database entities in Flow HQ. Cover Tenant entity with its lifecycle management, status tracking, and multi-tenant isolation. Document TenantConfig for business configuration including template types, language settings, and operational hours. Explain WhatsAppSession for connection state management, QR code handling, and session persistence. Detail MessageLog for conversation tracking, message direction, and audit trails. Cover WorkerProcess for automation status monitoring and process management. Include field definitions, data types, constraints, and business rules for each entity.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the NextAuth.js authentication system integration. Explain Google OAuth configuration, authentication callbacks and session management, sign-in page implementation, and sign-out functionality. Document the authentication state management, protected route handling, user role determination, and session persistence. Include practical examples of authentication flows, error handling strategies, and security considerations. Address the integration with the control plane API for user verification, tenant association, and permission management. Explain the SignInButton component implementation and custom authentication pages.

wiki_catalogs.name: Portal Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Portal REST API endpoints used by the tenant dashboard. Document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication methods for tenant-specific operations. Include detailed specifications for user management endpoints (GET /portal/me for current user info, POST /portal/setup-request for setup requests), tenant management endpoints (GET /portal/tenant/current for current tenant details, GET /portal/tenant/:id/status for tenant status, GET /portal/tenant/:id/logs for tenant logs, GET /portal/tenant/:id/qr for tenant QR code), and status monitoring endpoints (GET /portal/tenant/current/status for current tenant status). Document authentication via Portal Internal Key, error handling strategies, and security measures. Provide practical examples of API usage, client implementation guidelines for the frontend application, and integration patterns with the tenant dashboard.

wiki_catalogs.name: Rate Limiting System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the rate limiting utility system. Explain the token bucket algorithm implementation for controlling message processing rates per tenant. Document configurable rate limits, burst handling capabilities, and sliding window techniques. Include examples of rate limiter initialization, token consumption patterns, and rejection handling for exceeded limits. Explain tenant-specific rate configurations, dynamic rate adjustment mechanisms, and integration with the chat queue system. Address performance implications, memory usage for rate tracking, and monitoring approaches for rate limit violations. Provide configuration examples, troubleshooting common rate limiting issues, and best practices for optimal throughput balancing.

wiki_catalogs.name: TenantConfig Entity
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the TenantConfig entity that handles business configuration for each tenant. Document the template_type enum values (BOOKING, ECOMMERCE, SUPPORT) and their specific use cases. Explain business_name field for company identification and language settings (SW, EN) for localization. Detail hours_json field for business operating hours configuration. Cover the one-to-one relationship with Tenant and cascade deletion behavior. Include examples of configuration for different business types and language preferences.

wiki_catalogs.name: System Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for Flow HQ system design. Describe the high-level microservices architecture with three main components: Control Plane (admin API and dashboard), Worker (per-tenant WhatsApp automation), and Shared (common utilities and Prisma client). Document component interactions, data flows between tenant creation, worker process management, and WhatsApp Web integration. Explain technical decisions around multi-tenant isolation, PM2 process orchestration, and whatsapp-web.js integration. Include infrastructure requirements, scalability considerations with per-tenant worker processes, and deployment topology. Provide system context diagrams showing relationships between web portal, control plane, workers, and database. Address cross-cutting concerns like security, monitoring, and maintenance procedures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Shared Components Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed architectural documentation for the Shared Components system. Describe the monorepo shared package containing Prisma client, database schemas, logging utilities, and common types. Document the multi-tenant database design with tenant isolation, user management, and worker process tracking. Explain the logging architecture with Pino integration, structured logging patterns, and log file management. Include type definitions for consistent data modeling across applications. Address dependency sharing patterns, version management, and the role of shared components in maintaining consistency between web, control-plane, and worker applications.

wiki_catalogs.name: Template Selection and Customization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for template selection and customization capabilities within the multi-tenant system. Document the three template types (BOOKING, ECOMMERCE, SUPPORT) available for tenant configuration, template type enumeration, and customization options including business name, language settings, and operational hours. Explain template configuration persistence through TenantConfig model, template selection during tenant setup, and customization workflows. Include practical examples of template activation, parameter configuration, and business-specific customizations. Address template switching procedures, configuration validation, and impact on worker automation processes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Features
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Flow HQ core features. Document the multi-tenant WhatsApp automation capabilities, template-based message responses (Booking, E-commerce, Support), real-time worker status monitoring, QR code authentication, and message logging system. Explain the tenant isolation mechanism, worker process lifecycle management, and administrative dashboard functionality. Include practical examples of each feature, use cases for different business types, and feature limitations. Address the template system architecture, rate limiting implementation, and stability features like heartbeat monitoring and auto-recovery. Provide guidance on feature customization and extension possibilities.

wiki_catalogs.name: Message Processing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for message processing pipeline and handling workflows. Explain the message reception flow, duplicate message detection and prevention, chat queue management for sequential processing, and message routing to template handlers. Document the message lifecycle from receipt to response, including rate limiting enforcement, message logging, and error handling strategies. Include practical examples of message processing workflows, queue overflow handling, and message deduplication mechanisms. Address performance considerations, memory management, and message processing optimization techniques.

wiki_catalogs.name: E-commerce Template
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the E-commerce template functionality. Detail the product catalog response system, pricing inquiry handling, order placement workflows, and delivery information provision. Document the multilingual product search logic including Swahili keywords (bei/gharama for price, agiza for order) and English equivalents (price, order). Explain the response generation patterns for product inquiries, quantity requests, order confirmations, and delivery options. Include examples of product description responses, pricing information retrieval, order processing workflows, and integration with e-commerce business logic. Address inventory management integration, payment processing coordination, and customer service escalation paths.

wiki_catalogs.name: Heartbeat and Health Monitoring
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the heartbeat monitoring system and worker health checks. Explain the heartbeat mechanism implementation, stale worker detection thresholds, and automatic worker status updates. Document the markStaleWorkers function logic, last_seen_at timestamp tracking, and health check intervals. Include practical examples of heartbeat configuration, monitoring dashboard integration, and alerting systems. Address heartbeat packet formats, network timeout handling, and recovery from heartbeat failures. Explain the relationship between worker health and tenant status synchronization.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for User and SetupRequest entities in the database schema. Document User entity with role-based access control (OWNER, ADMIN, STAFF), authentication integration, and tenant association. Explain SetupRequest entity for business onboarding workflows including status tracking (SUBMITTED, REVIEWING, APPROVED, ACTIVE, REJECTED), template preferences, and approval processes. Detail the relationship between Users and SetupRequests, portal event logging, and user activity tracking. Include data validation rules, security considerations, and access control patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Portal Interface
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the tenant portal interface and user dashboard. Describe the portal layout structure, sidebar navigation component with tenant-specific menu items, status monitoring dashboard, and activity logs interface. Document the tenant management UI, worker status visualization, QR code authentication display, and real-time updates. Include practical examples of portal navigation patterns, responsive design implementation, and user interaction flows. Address the integration with portal API endpoints, data fetching strategies, and real-time status updates. Explain the component composition patterns for dashboard widgets and status indicators.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication & Middleware
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the Control Plane authentication and middleware system. Explain the authentication mechanisms including Basic Auth for admin endpoints and Portal Internal Key for tenant endpoints. Document the authMiddleware implementation, request validation, token verification, and security headers. Detail the middleware pipeline including CORS handling, body parsing, and error propagation. Include configuration requirements, environment variable validation, and security best practices. Provide examples of proper authentication header formatting, error responses for invalid credentials, and integration patterns with frontend applications. Address security considerations, rate limiting integration, and audit logging for authentication events.

wiki_catalogs.name: Message Deduplication
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the message deduplication system. Explain the duplicate detection mechanism using message identifiers, timestamps, and hash-based comparison algorithms. Document the deduplication cache management, TTL (Time-To-Live) configuration, and memory optimization strategies. Include examples of duplicate detection workflows, cache eviction policies, and false positive handling. Explain integration with the WhatsApp message processing pipeline, performance impact analysis, and scalability considerations for high-volume environments. Address configuration options for deduplication sensitivity, cache size limits, and monitoring approaches for deduplication effectiveness. Provide troubleshooting guidance for duplicate message processing and cache-related issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: WhatsAppSession Entity
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the WhatsAppSession entity that manages WhatsApp Web connection state. Document session states (DISCONNECTED, QR_READY, CONNECTED) and their transitions. Explain last_qr field for QR code storage and last_seen_at for heartbeat monitoring. Cover the one-to-one relationship with Tenant and automatic cleanup on tenant deletion. Detail the session lifecycle from initial setup through QR authentication to active connection. Include troubleshooting guidance for common session issues and connection state management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Multi-Tenant Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for Flow HQ multi-tenant management system. Detail tenant creation and configuration process, user authentication and authorization patterns, template selection and customization options, and setup request workflow. Document the Prisma multi-tenant database design with tenant isolation, user-role management, and template configuration persistence. Explain tenant lifecycle management from creation through deletion, including database schema relationships and data segregation. Include practical examples of tenant configuration, user onboarding flows, and administrative management through the control plane dashboard. Address security considerations for tenant isolation, access control patterns, and data privacy compliance.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Flow Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data flow documentation showing how information moves through the system. Document the complete data journey from user authentication through tenant creation, worker process initialization, WhatsApp Web message processing, and response generation. Explain the multi-tenant data isolation patterns, database transaction flows, and inter-component communication. Include message flow diagrams showing request/response patterns between web portal, control plane, and worker processes. Address data validation, error propagation, and audit trail mechanisms. Document the relationship between Prisma models and actual data transformations throughout the system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Setup Request Workflow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the setup request workflow system in Flow HQ. Detail the complete setup request lifecycle from submission through approval and activation, including status management (SUBMITTED, REVIEWING, APPROVED, ACTIVE, REJECTED). Document SetupRequest model relationships with Tenant and User entities, request validation processes, and administrative review procedures. Explain setup request creation through the web portal, automated processing workflows, and manual intervention capabilities. Include practical examples of setup request forms, approval workflows, rejection reasons, and status tracking. Address setup request auditing, notification systems, and integration with tenant activation processes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Platform Benefits
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Flow HQ platform benefits and value proposition. Explain how the multi-tenant architecture provides cost-effective WhatsApp automation for businesses, the isolation guarantees that ensure data security, and the template system that enables rapid deployment. Document the operational advantages including automated worker management, real-time monitoring, and built-in stability features. Compare the platform benefits against manual WhatsApp management, traditional CRM solutions, and custom chatbot development. Include case studies of potential business applications, ROI considerations, and scalability advantages. Address the technical benefits like rate limiting, error handling, and maintenance automation that reduce operational overhead.

wiki_catalogs.name: Connection Troubleshooting
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive troubleshooting documentation for WhatsApp connection issues and recovery procedures. Explain disconnection reasons, automatic reconnection mechanisms, manual reconnection procedures, and permanent failure scenarios. Document the reconnect manager functionality, heartbeat monitoring, and connection health indicators. Include practical troubleshooting steps for common issues like network connectivity problems, WhatsApp Web restrictions, Chrome/Chromium dependency issues, and session corruption. Address diagnostic procedures, log analysis techniques, and escalation paths for persistent connection problems.

wiki_catalogs.name: Support Template
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Support template implementation. Document the customer support response system including issue reporting, problem escalation, FAQ handling, and contact information provision. Explain the multilingual support logic with Swahili keywords (shida/tatizo for problems) and English equivalents (problem, issue). Detail the support workflow including initial problem acknowledgment, detailed issue collection, solution provision, and escalation to human agents. Include examples of support request patterns, automated troubleshooting responses, knowledge base integration, and integration with support ticketing systems. Address common support scenarios, priority handling, and customer satisfaction optimization techniques.

wiki_catalogs.name: Worker Status Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for worker status management and status tracking systems. Explain the different worker statuses (RUNNING, STOPPED, ERROR, QR_PENDING), status update mechanisms, and status persistence in the database. Document the status polling system, status change triggers, and status synchronization between components. Include practical examples of status queries, status-based routing, and status-dependent operations. Address status validation, status conflict resolution, and status history tracking for auditing purposes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Enums and Data Types
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document all database enums and custom data types used throughout the Flow HQ schema. Detail TenantStatus enum (NEW, QR_PENDING, ACTIVE, PAUSED, ERROR) and its impact on system behavior. Explain TemplateType (BOOKING, ECOMMERCE, SUPPORT) and business use cases. Document Language enum (SW, EN) for internationalization support. Cover SessionState for WhatsApp connection management, MessageDirection for message flow tracking, WorkerStatus for process monitoring, and UserRole for access control. Include default values, validation rules, and business implications of each enum value.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for API integration patterns and data management. Explain the portal API endpoints for user profile management, setup requests, tenant status monitoring, and QR code generation. Document the Prisma client integration for database operations, API route handlers implementation, and data fetching strategies. Include practical examples of GET/POST request handling, response formatting, error handling, and authentication verification. Address the integration with the control plane API, request/response schemas, and real-time data synchronization. Explain caching strategies, loading states, and error boundary implementations for robust user experience.

wiki_catalogs.name: Reconnection Handling
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the reconnection handling system. Explain the exponential backoff algorithm implementation for automatic WhatsApp connection recovery. Document retry mechanisms, maximum retry limits, and jitter implementation to prevent thundering herd effects. Include examples of connection failure detection, reconnection attempts, and graceful degradation strategies. Explain integration with the main bot lifecycle, heartbeat monitoring for connection health, and manual intervention options. Address configuration parameters for retry intervals, timeout thresholds, and connection state persistence. Provide troubleshooting guidance for persistent connection issues, network problem diagnosis, and recovery procedure validation. Include monitoring approaches for reconnection success rates and connection stability metrics.

wiki_catalogs.name: MessageLog Entity
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the MessageLog entity for conversation tracking and audit trails. Detail message direction enum (IN/OUT) and field meanings for from_number, to_number, and message_text. Explain wa_message_id for WhatsApp message correlation and tenant_id for multi-tenant isolation. Cover indexing strategy for performance optimization and query patterns. Document message flow from incoming customer messages to automated responses. Include examples of message logging for different business scenarios and audit trail usage.

wiki_catalogs.name: WhatsApp Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for WhatsApp Web API integration and automation. Explain the whatsapp-web.js library integration, QR code authentication flow from scanning to session establishment, session management and persistence, and connection troubleshooting procedures. Document the worker process lifecycle, WhatsApp session states (DISCONNECTED, QR_READY, CONNECTED), and automatic reconnection mechanisms. Include practical examples of message processing workflows, template-based response generation, and error handling strategies. Address common issues like QR code display problems, session persistence failures, and WhatsApp Web connectivity issues. Provide guidance on Chrome/Chromium dependencies, executable path configuration, and system requirements for reliable operation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Custom Template Development
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for developing custom template types. Explain the template extension mechanism, interface requirements for new template implementations, and integration patterns with the existing template system. Document the template registration process, configuration object structure, and response generation patterns. Include step-by-step guides for creating new template types, implementing business-specific logic, and integrating with external systems. Provide examples of template inheritance patterns, shared utility functions, multilingual support implementation, and testing strategies for custom templates. Address template versioning, backward compatibility, and deployment considerations for custom template implementations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Migrations and Schema Evolution
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for Prisma schema migrations and database evolution strategy. Explain migration lifecycle, creation process, and deployment procedures. Document how schema changes are tracked, versioned, and applied across environments. Detail best practices for safe schema modifications, data preservation during migrations, and rollback procedures. Include examples of common migration scenarios, constraint handling, and index management. Address migration conflicts, testing strategies, and production deployment considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: WorkerProcess Entity
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the WorkerProcess entity that tracks automation worker status. Document worker status enum (RUNNING, STOPPED, ERROR) and their implications for system monitoring. Explain pm2_name field for process identification and last_error field for error tracking. Cover the one-to-one relationship with Tenant and automatic cleanup behavior. Detail worker lifecycle from startup through monitoring to error recovery. Include examples of worker status monitoring, error handling, and process management workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Template System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the template-based message response system. Detail the template architecture design, implementation patterns for different business types (Booking, E-commerce, Support), and extensibility mechanisms for custom templates. Document the template selection process during tenant creation, response logic implementation, multilingual support (Swahili/English), and template customization options. Include practical examples of template response generation, message parsing and routing, and template-specific business logic. Explain the template registration system, template type enumeration, and integration with the Prisma schema. Provide guidance on creating new template types, implementing business-specific response logic, and maintaining template consistency across tenants.

wiki_catalogs.name: User and SetupRequest Entities
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for User and SetupRequest entities that handle authentication and tenant setup workflows. Document user roles (OWNER, STAFF, ADMIN) and their permission levels. Explain SetupRequestStatus enum (SUBMITTED, REVIEWING, APPROVED, ACTIVE, REJECTED) and workflow transitions. Cover relationships between User, Tenant, and SetupRequest entities. Detail the setup request process from submission through approval to tenant activation. Include examples of user management, role assignments, and setup request workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Worker Orchestration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for worker process orchestration and management. Explain PM2 integration for process lifecycle management, worker process creation and termination, status monitoring and health checks, and automatic recovery mechanisms. Document the worker startup sequence, process isolation between tenants, heartbeat monitoring system, and stale worker detection. Include practical examples of worker management commands, process status checking, and troubleshooting failed workers. Address worker scaling strategies, resource allocation, memory management, and performance optimization. Explain the relationship between control plane API endpoints and worker process management, including start/stop/restart operations and QR code retrieval.

wiki_catalogs.name: PortalEventLog Entity
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the PortalEventLog entity for tracking user portal activities and system events. Detail event_type field for categorizing different actions and payload_json for storing event data. Explain tenant_id indexing for efficient querying and time-based filtering. Cover the relationship with User entity for user activity tracking. Include examples of common event types, event data structures, and analytics use cases for portal usage monitoring.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Design
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for Flow HQ database schema. Detail entity relationships between Tenant, TenantConfig, WhatsAppSession, MessageLog, and WorkerProcess tables. Document field definitions, data types, primary/foreign key relationships, indexes, and database constraints. Explain multi-tenant data isolation principles, schema evolution through Prisma migrations, and data validation rules. Include database schema diagrams showing table relationships and sample data examples. Document data access patterns, caching strategies, and performance considerations for high-throughput scenarios. Specify data lifecycle management, retention policies, and archival strategies. Address data security measures, backup procedures, and disaster recovery planning.

wiki_catalogs.name: Frontend Application
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the Next.js frontend application and user interface. Describe the application structure with marketing pages and portal interface, authentication integration using NextAuth.js with Google OAuth, tenant dashboard functionality, and API integration patterns. Document the middleware implementation for authentication and authorization, sidebar navigation components, and responsive design patterns. Include practical examples of user authentication flows, tenant management interfaces, and portal navigation. Address component composition patterns, state management strategies, and integration with the control plane API. Explain the layout system, styling with Tailwind CSS, and user experience considerations for business owners managing multiple tenants.

wiki_catalogs.name: Control Plane API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Control Plane REST API endpoints. Document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication methods for all administrative endpoints. Include detailed specifications for tenant management (POST /admin/tenants, GET /admin/tenants, GET /admin/tenants/:id), worker management (POST /admin/tenants/:id/worker/start, stop, restart), QR code retrieval (GET /admin/tenants/:id/qr), and message logging (GET /admin/tenants/:id/logs). Document authentication via Basic Auth or query parameters, error handling strategies, rate limiting considerations, and security measures. Provide practical examples of API usage, client implementation guidelines, and integration patterns with the frontend application.

wiki_catalogs.name: Worker Utilities
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for worker utility systems and operational features. Explain rate limiting implementation with configurable limits per tenant, chat queue management for sequential message processing, message deduplication to prevent duplicate processing, and exponential backoff reconnection handling. Document the heartbeat monitoring system for worker health tracking, stale worker detection mechanisms, and automatic recovery procedures. Include practical examples of utility configuration, performance tuning, and troubleshooting operational issues. Address the relationship between utilities and worker stability, error handling strategies, and system reliability features. Explain configuration parameters, logging patterns, and monitoring approaches for optimal worker performance.

wiki_catalogs.name: Logging and Monitoring
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for logging architecture and monitoring systems. Detail the structured logging implementation using Pino logger with file transport, log file organization by tenant, and centralized log management. Document error tracking mechanisms, performance monitoring approaches, and alerting strategies. Include practical examples of log analysis, debugging techniques, and troubleshooting workflows. Explain log rotation policies, retention management, and log aggregation for production environments. Address monitoring dashboards, health check endpoints, and operational metrics collection. Provide guidance on log interpretation, common error patterns, and performance optimization based on log analysis.

wiki_catalogs.name: Security Considerations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive security documentation for Flow HQ platform. Detail authentication security using NextAuth.js with Google OAuth, authorization patterns for tenant isolation, environment configuration security, and data protection measures. Document security best practices for production deployment including firewall configuration, SSL/TLS setup, and secure credential management. Include practical examples of security configurations, vulnerability assessment procedures, and incident response protocols. Address session security, API authentication security, database encryption, and secure communication channels. Explain security checklist items, regular security audits, and compliance considerations for production environments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive deployment documentation for Flow HQ platform. Include detailed VPS setup procedures for Ubuntu/Debian systems, PostgreSQL database configuration, PM2 process management, and reverse proxy setup with Nginx. Document environment configuration, SSL certificate setup with Let's Encrypt, and production verification procedures. Include practical examples of deployment commands, system dependency installation, and service configuration. Address monitoring and maintenance procedures, log management, backup strategies, and disaster recovery planning. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common deployment issues, performance optimization, and scaling considerations for production environments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Development Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive development documentation for Flow HQ platform. Include local development setup with workspace configuration, TypeScript compilation settings, and development server configuration. Document code organization patterns, testing strategies with the stress test script, and contribution guidelines. Explain the monorepo structure, package interdependencies, and build processes. Include practical examples of adding new features, creating custom templates, extending the API, and debugging techniques. Address development best practices, code quality standards, and collaborative development workflows. Provide guidance on extending functionality, adding new template types, and maintaining codebase consistency.

wiki_catalogs.name: Troubleshooting
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive troubleshooting documentation for Flow HQ platform. Include systematic approaches to diagnosing common issues, error diagnosis procedures, and performance tuning strategies. Document troubleshooting workflows for QR code authentication problems, worker process failures, database connection issues, and WhatsApp Web integration problems. Include practical examples of log analysis, error pattern recognition, and resolution procedures. Address performance bottlenecks, memory leaks, and scalability issues. Provide guidance on using monitoring tools, interpreting error messages, and implementing preventive measures. Include escalation procedures for critical issues and coordination with system administrators.

wiki_overview.content:
I'll analyze this WhatsApp automation project step by step, examining its structure and components.

<blog>

# Flow HQ Bot - WhatsApp Business Automation Platform

## Project Introduction

**Flow HQ Bot** is a comprehensive WhatsApp Business automation platform designed to help businesses automate customer interactions through intelligent chatbot solutions. The project provides a complete infrastructure for managing multiple tenant accounts, handling WhatsApp authentication, and processing customer messages at scale.

### Purpose Statement
The platform enables businesses to deploy WhatsApp chatbots without requiring technical expertise in WhatsApp API integration. It offers a multi-tenant architecture supporting different business templates including booking systems, e-commerce solutions, and customer support.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- **Multi-Tenant Architecture**: Support multiple business clients with isolated configurations
- **WhatsApp Integration**: Seamless WhatsApp Web API integration for automated messaging
- **Template-Based Solutions**: Pre-built automation templates for common business scenarios
- **Real-time Monitoring**: Live dashboard for tenant management and worker status monitoring
- **Scalable Infrastructure**: Worker processes that can handle high-volume message processing

### Target Audience
- Small to medium business owners seeking WhatsApp automation
- Developers building custom WhatsApp business solutions
- Enterprise teams managing multiple client WhatsApp accounts

## Technical Architecture

The project follows a **monorepo architecture** with clear separation of concerns across three main components:

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Web Frontend] --> B[Control Plane API]
    B --> C[Worker Processes]
    B --> D[Database Layer]
    C --> E[WhatsApp Web API]
    F[Shared Package] --> A
    F --> B
    F --> C
    G[PM2 Process Manager] --> C
```

### Component Breakdown

**1. Web Frontend (`apps/web/`)**
- Next.js application providing the administrative interface
- User authentication via Google OAuth
- Tenant management dashboard
- Real-time worker status monitoring

**2. Control Plane (`apps/control-plane/`)**
- Express.js REST API for administrative operations
- PM2 process management for worker orchestration
- Tenant lifecycle management
- Worker health monitoring and maintenance

**3. Worker Processes (`apps/worker/`)**
- Individual process per tenant for WhatsApp communication
- Message processing and response generation
- Session management and QR code authentication
- Template-based message automation

**4. Shared Package (`packages/shared/`)**
- Common utilities and logging
- Prisma database schemas and client
- Type definitions and interfaces
- Cross-project dependencies

### Design Patterns

The architecture implements several key design patterns:

- **Microservices Pattern**: Separate worker processes for each tenant
- **Repository Pattern**: Prisma client abstraction in shared package
- **Factory Pattern**: Template-based message creation
- **Observer Pattern**: Heartbeat monitoring for worker status
- **Command Pattern**: PM2 process management commands

### System Relationships

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant Admin as Admin Interface
    participant API as Control Plane API
    participant PM2 as PM2 Manager
    participant Worker as WhatsApp Worker
    participant WA as WhatsApp Web
    
    Admin->>API: Start Worker Request
    API->>PM2: Launch Worker Process
    PM2->>Worker: Initialize with Tenant ID
    Worker->>WA: Authenticate via QR Code
    WA-->>Worker: Connection Established
    Worker->>API: Send Heartbeat
    API->>Admin: Update Status
```

## Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points

**Web Application Entry Point**
- `apps/web/src/app/layout.tsx` - Root layout with provider setup
- `apps/web/src/middleware.ts` - Authentication middleware for protected routes

**Control Plane Entry Point**
- `apps/control-plane/src/server.ts` - Express server with environment validation
- `apps/control-plane/src/routes/admin.ts` - Administrative API endpoints

**Worker Entry Point**
- `apps/worker/src/worker.ts` - Worker initialization and lifecycle management

### Core Modules

**Authentication System**
- `apps/web/src/lib/auth.ts` - NextAuth configuration with Google OAuth
- `apps/web/src/lib/prisma.ts` - Prisma client singleton pattern
- `apps/control-plane/src/middleware/auth.ts` - Admin authentication middleware

**Database Schema**
- `packages/shared/src/prisma/schema.prisma` - Multi-tenant database model
- Supports tenant isolation, user management, and worker tracking

**Message Processing**
- `apps/worker/src/bot.ts` - WhatsApp bot implementation
- `apps/worker/src/utils/chat-queue.ts` - Message queuing system
- `apps/worker/src/templates/` - Template-based message automation

### Configuration Approach

**Environment Variables**
- `.env.example` - Complete environment configuration template
- `apps/web/.env.local` - Frontend-specific configuration
- `ecosystem.config.js` - PM2 process management configuration

**Build Configuration**
- `package.json` - Workspace configuration with npm scripts
- `tsconfig.json` - TypeScript compilation settings
- `next.config.js` - Next.js optimization settings

### External Dependencies

**Frontend Dependencies**
- `next`: React-based web framework
- `next-auth`: Authentication solution
- `@auth/prisma-adapter`: Prisma database adapter
- `tailwindcss`: Utility-first CSS framework

**Backend Dependencies**
- `express`: Web application framework
- `whatsapp-web.js`: WhatsApp Web API wrapper
- `pm2`: Process manager for worker processes
- `prisma`: Database ORM and migration tool

**Development Dependencies**
- `typescript`: Type safety and development experience
- `tsx`: TypeScript execution runtime
- `autoprefixer`: CSS vendor prefix automation

### Integration Points

**WhatsApp Web Integration**
- `apps/worker/src/bot.ts` - Core WhatsApp bot functionality
- QR code authentication and session management
- Message sending and receiving capabilities

**Database Integration**
- `packages/shared/src/prisma/schema.prisma` - Multi-tenant data model
- Tenant, user, worker process, and message log entities
- Automatic migrations and schema validation

**Process Management**
- `apps/control-plane/src/routes/admin.ts` - PM2 process orchestration
- Worker lifecycle management and health monitoring
- Graceful shutdown and restart capabilities

### Component Relationship Diagrams

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Web Frontend] --> B[NextAuth Middleware]
    B --> C[Control Plane API]
    C --> D[PM2 Process Manager]
    D --> E[Worker Process]
    E --> F[WhatsApp Web API]
    C --> G[Database Layer]
    G --> H[Prisma Client]
    H --> I[Tenant Management]
    H --> J[User Authentication]
    H --> K[Worker Tracking]
```

## Key Features

### Functionality Overview

**Multi-Tenant Management**
- Isolated tenant environments with separate configurations
- Template-based automation for different business types
- Role-based access control for user management

**WhatsApp Automation**
- QR code-based authentication for WhatsApp Web
- Template-driven message responses
- Real-time conversation monitoring
- Message logging and analytics

**Operational Management**
- Live worker status monitoring
- Automated worker health checks
- Process restart and recovery mechanisms
- Real-time dashboard for administrative oversight

### Implementation Highlights

**Template System**
- `apps/worker/src/templates/booking.ts` - Booking appointment automation
- `apps/worker/src/templates/index.ts` - Template registry and management
- Configurable business logic per tenant

**Rate Limiting and Queue Management**
- `apps/worker/src/utils/rate-limiter.ts` - Message throttling
- `apps/worker/src/utils/chat-queue.ts` - Conversation queue management
- `apps/worker/src/utils/dedup.ts` - Duplicate message prevention

**Worker Lifecycle Management**
- `apps/control-plane/src/routes/admin.ts` - Worker process orchestration
- Heartbeat monitoring and stale worker detection
- Graceful startup and shutdown procedures

### Feature Architecture Diagrams

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> NewTenant: Create Tenant
    NewTenant --> QR_PENDING: Start Worker
    QR_PENDING --> AUTHENTICATED: Scan QR Code
    AUTHENTICATED --> RUNNING: Worker Active
    RUNNING --> ERROR: Worker Failure
    ERROR --> RUNNING: Auto Restart
    RUNNING --> STOPPED: Stop Worker
    STOPPED --> [*]: Cleanup
    
    state QR_PENDING {
        [*] --> WaitingForQR: Display QR
        WaitingForQR --> ScanningQR: User Scans
        ScanningQR --> Authenticated: QR Scanned
    }
```

**Performance Considerations**
- PM2 process isolation for tenant separation
- Database connection pooling and optimization
- Message queuing for high-throughput scenarios
- Heartbeat monitoring for system reliability

**Security Features**
- Google OAuth authentication
- Environment variable validation
- Database query sanitization
- Process isolation between tenants

**Scalability Architecture**
- Horizontal scaling through worker processes
- Database sharding by tenant ID
- Load balancing across multiple instances
- Auto-healing worker processes

---

**Sources:**
- [package.json](package.json)
- [apps/web/package.json](apps/web/package.json)
- [apps/control-plane/package.json](apps/control-plane/package.json)
- [apps/worker/package.json](apps/worker/package.json)
- [packages/shared/package.json](packages/shared/package.json)
- [apps/web/src/app/layout.tsx](apps/web/src/app/layout.tsx)
- [apps/web/src/middleware.ts](apps/web/src/middleware.ts)
- [apps/control-plane/src/server.ts](apps/control-plane/src/server.ts)
- [apps/worker/src/worker.ts](apps/worker/src/worker.ts)
- [packages/shared/src/index.ts](packages/shared/src/index.ts)
- [packages/shared/src/types/index.ts](packages/shared/src/types/index.ts)
- [apps/web/src/lib/prisma.ts](apps/web/src/lib/prisma.ts)
- [apps/web/src/lib/auth.ts](apps/web/src/lib/auth.ts)
- [apps/control-plane/src/routes/admin.ts](apps/control-plane/src/routes/admin.ts)
- [apps/web/src/app/(portal)/layout.tsx](apps/web/src/app/(portal)/layout.tsx)

</blog>
